ai-ud3.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-ud3.7:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying in the Pipphali cave. Having entered a certain state of immersion, he sat cross-legged for seven days without moving.
ai-ud3.7:1.4_0: When seven days had passed, Mahākassapa emerged from that state of immersion.
ai-ud3.7:1.6_0: “Why don’t I enter Rājagaha for alms?”
ai-ud3.7:2.1_0: Now at that time around five hundred deities had committed to Mahākassapa.
ai-ud3.7:2.2_0: But Mahākasspa refused those deities. In the morning, he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Rājagaha for alms.
ai-ud3.7:3.1_0: Now at that time Sakka, lord of Gods, wished to give alms to Mahākassapa.
ai-ud3.7:3.2_0: Having manifested in the appearance of a weaver, he worked the loom while the demon maiden Sujā fed the shuttle.
ai-ud3.7:3.3_0: and filled the castle of the demons in Vedas.
ai-ud3.7:3.4_0: Then, as Mahākassapa wandered indiscriminately for alms-food in Rājagaha, he approached Sakka’s house.
ai-ud3.7:3.5_0: Seeing Mahākassapa coming off in the distance,
ai-ud3.7:3.6_0: Sakka came out of his house, greeted him, and took the bowl from his hand. He re-entered the house and filled the bowl with rice from the pot.
ai-ud3.7:3.7_0: That alms-food had many tasty soups and sauces.

ai-ud3.7:3.14_0: don’t do such a thing again.”

ai-ud3.7:4.1_0: Then Sakka bowed and respectfully circled Mahākassapa, keeping him on his right. Then he rose into the air and, sitting cross-legged in the sky, expressed this heartfelt sentiment three times:
ai-ud3.7:4.2_0: “Oh the gift, the best gift is well established in Kassapa!
ai-ud3.7:4.3_0: Oh the gift, the best gift is well established in Kassapa!
ai-ud3.7:4.4_0: Oh the gift, the best gift is well established in Kassapa!”
ai-ud3.7:4.5_0: With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha heard Sakka express this heartfelt sentiment while sitting in the sky.
